name: Political Thought from Freud to Foucault
description: The purpose of the course is to survey the work of some leading political thinkers of the 20th century. The seminar will begin with a discussion of Sigmund Freud and Max Weber, and thereafter will focus on six key political philosophers: Hannah Arendt, Leo Strauss, Alasdair MacIntyre, Michael Foucault, Jurgen Habermas and John Rawls. Restrictions: 1) 400-series POL courses are limited to POL Specialists and Joint Specialits; 2) No POL Specialist may take more than 2.0 POL credits at the 400-level (1.0 for Joint Specialists). 3) Prior completion of POL 320Y is desirable though not required
